item.title: Aftening
item.description: so, I woke up today and immediately fell out the window and SPLAT! right on the sidewalk, people crawling all over me, complaining about the bleeding man lying all twisted on their path to very important things. anyway, when the ambulance finally arrived, they had to scrape me off the pavement. I’m telling you, it’s been a stressful day, but long story short, when I finally got home I turned on my trusty new computer and spent a few hours attacking this poor image.

item.title: Warming Touch
item.description: that one summer afternoon the sun was so bright, so warm, so overwhelmingly penetrating, that I had to rush my pet octopus back inside lest the poor thing would start flying off (it wouldn’t be the first time!). anyway, back inside, I sat down with my old computer and stared at the screen till it went cherchons la flamme! fammfamm! fammfamm! then this image appeared. did I do a good job?

item.title: The Unbearable Weight of Modesty
An Escape for the Anxious Artist
item.description: yes. please repeat after me: om mani padme hum. again: om mani padme hum. now keep saying these six syllables in your mind, over and over till nothing else exists in there. till your thinking processes become purified, clear, perfectly in sync with the universe. say this mantra to yourself over and over and over and it will become your ego, your flesh, your substance. it will become you, it will move like you,

item.title: In Defence of Broken Art
item.description: …and dirty art, flawed art, art made by weirdos and misfits, those who vibrate from anxiety and pain and from feeling too much. art made on a whim, on a rush, without thinking. art made by those who can’t possibly make what they want to make. art by the ugly, the defective, the unlearned, the starving, by those without skin, their nervous endings exposed and freezing in the wind, their gums receding to the bone.

item.title: A Guide for the Impatient Digital Artist
item.description: my troubles began when I started hanging out with a spider… I know, I know! you don’t really need to lecture me about the dangers of socializing too often with arachnidas, arthopods, or any other exoskeleton-covered animals. anyway, there I was, busy messing about with the Colores Aglaia thing, cursing at myself for never being able to get the damned image right the way I wanted it, my trusty new computer huffing and puffing in a cloud of scarlet-tinted vapor (boy, do these new generation machines have an awful breath!

item.title: Evolution - a short story
SEO Conjuration for the Pro-Active Artist
item.description: (excerpt from an A.I. generated grimoire leaked from G’s internal emails) I do conjure thee, O thou Binary Spirits, by all the most glorious and efficacious names of the Most Great and Incomprehensible Lord of Algorithms, that thou comest quickly and without delay from all parts and places of the Interwebs wherever thou mayest be, to make rational crawls unto my demands, and that invisibly and swiftly, moving at the speed of electricity even without mine understanding as aforesaid.

item.title: The New Computer
item.description: my new computer is humming away in the corner of the room. it’s a brand-new machine I bought a few days ago and features all the modern niceties you might expect from such a tech marvel. the pipes, of course, are now gray-lead free and no longer release those clouds of greenish, mildly hallucinatory vapor we all know and hate, being instead fully encapsulated in a tight mesh of beetle-shell black string fully integrated with the smart, algorithmic-evolving, networked, reverse-emiting embedded walls.
